conclusion: To determine the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second, we can follow these steps:
The graph shows the position x over time t in a linear fashion, indicating constant velocity.
The graph intersects the y-axis at x = 10 meters when t = 0 seconds.

premise: The graph intersects the y-axis at x = 10 meters when t = 0 seconds.
conclusion: The slope of the graph will give us the velocity.

premise: At t = -2 seconds, x = 0 meters. At t = 0 seconds, x = 10 meters.
conclusion: The slope m is (10 meters - 0 meters) / (0 seconds - (-2 seconds)) = 10/2 = 5 m/s.

premise: The graph is linear, and the slope is 5 m/s.
conclusion: The speed at any time, including the end of the 2nd second, is 5 m/s.
